ca.mcgill.ecse211.team11

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.team11.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls the motors and moves the robot according to the information given by the odometer.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Justin Szeto

        Turn robot to specified heading using a minimum angle.
        Parameters:

        stop - - true to stop motors once finished turning. false to let motors continue

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double heading,
          boolean clockwise,
          boolean stop)
        Turn robot to specified heading while turning in specified direction.
        Parameters:
        heading - - Heading to turn to
        clockwise - - true to turn clockwise. false to turn counterclockwise.
        stop - - true to stop motors once finished turning. false to let motors continue

      • turn

        public void turn(double angle,
        boolean stop)
        Turns the robot by a specified angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - - Angle for robot to turn. Positive for clockwise. Negative for counterclockwise.
        stop - - true to stop motors once finished turning. false to let motors continue
